summary: Ranch dressing is a popular, creamy salad dressing in the U.S., made with buttermilk, garlic, onion, herbs, and spices mixed into mayonnaise. It often includes sour cream or yogurt. Since 1992, it's been the top-selling dressing in America, surpassing Italian dressing. Many people also use it as a dip or on chips. In 2017, 40% of Americans chose ranch as their favorite. It's especially loved in the Midwest.
title: Ranch dressing
